perturbation.original_text: The Principal appoints the Distributor as a non-exclusive distributor, to sell Principal's qPCR infectious disease kits, Logix Smart COVID-19 PCR diagnostic test and Co-Dx Box™ instrument (the "Products"). The Products are described on Exhibit A to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Principal appoints the Distributor as a non-exclusive vendor, to sell Principal's qPCR infectious disease kits, Logix Smart COVID-19 PCR diagnostic test and Co-Dx Box™ instrument (the "Products"). The Goods are described on Exhibit A to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'distributor' and 'vendor' are used interchangeably to refer to the same entity, but 'Products' is changed to 'Goods'. This introduces confusion as to whether the agreement applies to 'Products' as defined or some other type of 'Goods,' creating a contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: The Distributor accepts the appointment and shall use its commercially reasonable efforts to promote, market and sell the Products within the Territory, devote such time and attention as may be reasonably necessary and abide by the Principal's policies.
perturbation.changed_text: The Distributor accepts the appointment and shall use its commercially reasonable efforts to promote, market and sell the Deliverables within the Territory, devote such time and attention as may be reasonably necessary and abide by the Principal's guidelines.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Products' is being replaced with 'Deliverables' and 'policies' is being replaced with 'guidelines' without redefining them. The reader cannot be sure what the responsibilities are with selling products, which could also be interpreted as services or other deliverables. In addition, it's not clear whether guidelines have the same level of authority as policies. These changes creates confusion as to what the distributor is expected to sell and follow.

perturbation.original_text: Principal will grant Distributor a discount based on the Products and Prices. The proposed discount is expected to be ¨%. Discount may vary depending on product volume ordered or promotions.
perturbation.changed_text: Principal will grant Distributor a rebate based on the Items and Tariffs. The proposed rebate is expected to be ¨%. Rebate may vary depending on item volume ordered or special offerings.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'discount' is being replaced with 'rebate', 'Products' with 'Items' and 'Prices' with 'Tariffs'. This creates ambiguity because it is not specified in the contract whether a discount and rebate mean the same thing. Also, it's ambiguous as to what items the rebate applies to.
